sentences.text: Oversight of Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business faces various risks, including strategic, financial, operational and compliance risks:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for the day-to-day assessment, management and mitigation of risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying, managing and mitigating our exposure to these risks and effectively overseeing this process are critical to our operational decision-making and annual planning processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has ultimate responsibility for risk oversight, but it has delegated primary responsibility for overseeing risk assessment and management to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to its charter, the Audit Committee reviews and discusses risk assessment and risk management guidelines, policies and processes utilized in our Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our ERM process is ongoing and implemented at all levels of our operations and across business units to identify, assess, monitor, manage and mitigate risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our ERM process facilitates open communication between management and the Board so that the Board and committees understand key risks to our business and performance, our risk management process and how it is functioning, the participants in the process and the information gathered through the process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee annually reviews the functioning of our ERM process as well as the results of our annual ERM risk assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the Audit Committee reviews and approves managements recommendation for allocating to the full Board or another committee or retaining for itself responsibility for reviewing and assessing key risk exposures and managements response to those exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management provides reports to the Board and the appropriate committee in advance of meetings regarding key risks and the actions management has taken to monitor, control and mitigate these risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also attends Board and committee meetings to discuss these reports and provide any updates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committees report key risk discussions to the Board following their meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board members may also further discuss the risk management process directly with members of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MONDELZ INTERNATIONAL    23
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Board and committees reviewed and assessed risks related to our business and operations as shown below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board annually reviews and sometimes reallocates responsibilities amongst committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the allocation of responsibilities shown in this table may change during 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board   Audit   Governance, Membership and Public Affairs   Human Resources and Compensation(1)   Finance Strategy   Operations   Food safety (including supply chain and food defense)   Competition (including private label and customer concentration)   Capital structure   Financial strategies and transactions (including economic trends)   Labor relations (including human capital)   Transformation (including zero- based budgeting, supply chain reinvention and the coffee business transactions)   Financial statements   Financial reporting process   Accounting matters   Legal, compliance and regulatory matters (including non-financial compliance risks)   Business continuity/operations   Sovereign risk   Financial risk management (including foreign exchange, commodities exposure, and income and other taxes)   Health, safety and environmental   Governance programs   Board organization, membership and structure   Related person transactions   Social responsibility   Public policy   Mondelz Internationals public image and reputation   Compensation policies and practices for all employees (including executives)   Succession planning   Human resources policies and practices   Interest rate exposure   Enterprise funding and liquidity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) For a discussion about risk oversight relating to the compensation programs, see Board Committees and Membership  Human Resources and Compensation Committee  How the Compensation Committee Manages Compensation-Related Risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Codes of Conduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Non-Employee Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Non-Employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It fosters a culture of honesty and integrity, focuses on areas of ethical risk, guides non-employee directors in recognizing and handling ethical issues and provides mechanisms to report unethical conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, each non-employee director must acknowledge in writing that he or she has received, reviewed and understands the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Non-Employee Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Conduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted the Code of Conduct that applies to all of our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It includes policies that cover ethical and legal practices for every aspect of the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct reflects values and contains important rules employees must follow when conducting business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Conduct is part of our global compliance and integrity program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program provides training throughout the Company and encourages reporting of wrongdoing by offering anonymous reporting options and a non-retaliation policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will disclose in the Corporate Governance section of our website any amendments to the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for Non-Employee Directors or Code of Conduct and any waiver granted to an executive officer or director under these codes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: Review of Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Persons Policy and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a written policy regarding related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, related persons are the following persons and their immediate family members: directors, executive officers and shareholders beneficially owning more than 5% of the outstanding Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A related person transaction is one in which Mondelz International is a participant, the amount involved exceeds $120,000 and any related person had, has or will have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee reviews transactions that might qualify as related person transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Governance Committee determines that a transaction qualifies as a related person transaction, then the Governance Committee reviews and approves, disapproves or ratifies the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee approves or ratifies only those related person transactions that are fair and reasonable to Mondelz International and in our shareholders best interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When it is not practicable or desirable to delay review of a transaction until a committee meeting, the chair of the Governance Committee reviews and approves or ratifies potential related person transactions and reports to the Governance Committee any transaction so approved or ratified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When reviewing and acting on a related person transaction under this policy, the Governance Committee considers, among other things:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: its commercial reasonableness;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board established the Audit Committee in accordance with Section 3(a)(58)(A) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the Exchange Act).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all of the Audit Committee members are independent within the meaning of the NASDAQ listing standards and Rule 10A-3 of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also determined that all Audit Committee members are able to read and understand financial statements in accordance with NASDAQ listing standards and are financially literate in accordance with the New York Stock Exchange listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that Fredric G. Reynolds and Patrick T. Siewert are audit committee financial experts within the meaning of SEC regulations and has financial sophistication in accordance with NASDAQ listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Audit Committee member received any payments in 2016 from us other than compensation for service as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Audit Committee is responsible for overseeing our accounting and financial reporting processes and audits of our financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of our independent registered public accountants, including review of their qualifications, independence and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other duties, the Audit Committee also oversees:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the integrity of our financial statements, our accounting and financial reporting processes, and our systems of internal control over financial reporting and safeguarding our assets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the performance of our internal auditors and internal audit functions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our guidelines and policies with respect to risk assessment and risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has established procedures for the receipt, retention and treatment, on a confidential basis, of any complaints we receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage employees and third-party individuals and organizations to report concerns about our accounting controls, auditing matters or anything else that appears to involve financial or other wrongdoing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To report such matters, please visit http://www.mondelezinternational.com/about-us/compliance-and-integrity for information about reporting options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report for the Year Ended December 31, 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has primary responsibility for Mondelz Internationals financial statements and the reporting process, including the systems of internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our role as the Audit Committee of the Mondelz International Board of Directors is to oversee Mondelz Internationals accounting and financial reporting processes and audits of its financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2016 we assisted the Board in its oversight of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mondelz Internationals compliance with legal and regulatory requirements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mondelz Internationals independent registered public accountants qualifications, independence and performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance of Mondelz Internationals internal auditor and the internal audit function; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mondelz Internationals risk assessment and risk management guidelines and policies.

sentences.text: Pre-Approval Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees policy is to pre-approve all audit and non-audit services provided by the independent registered public accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These services may include audit services, audit-related services, tax services and other permissible non-audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pre-approval authority details the particular service or category of service that the independent registered public accountants will perform.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management reports to the Audit Committee on the actual fees charged by the independent registered public accountants for each category of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the year, circumstances may arise when it becomes necessary to engage the independent registered public accountants for additional services not contemplated in the original pre-approval authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In those instances, the committee approves the services before we engage the independent registered public accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In case approval is needed before a scheduled committee meeting, the committee has delegated pre-approval authority to its Chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair must report on such pre-approval decisions at the committees next regular meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee pre-approved all 2016 audit and non-audit services provided by the independent registered public accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Fees include
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the integrated audit of our consolidated financial statements, including statutory audits of the financial statements of our affiliates, and our internal control over financial reporting and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit-Related Fees include professional services in connection with employee benefit plan audits, due diligence related to acquisitions and divestitures and procedures related to various other audit and special reports.

sentences.text: All Other Fees include professional services in connection with seminars and compliance reviews.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees Use of an Independent Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee retains an independent compensation consultant to assist it in evaluating executive compensation programs and advise it regarding the amount and form of executive and director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It uses a consultant to provide additional assurance that our executive and director compensation programs are reasonable, competitive and consistent with our objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It directly engages the consultant under an engagement letter that the Compensation Committee reviews at least annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since September 2009, the Compensation Committee has retained Compensation Advisory Partners, LLC (CAP) as its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, the Compensation Committee reviews CAPs engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, CAP provided the Compensation Committee advice and services, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: regularly participating in Compensation Committee meetings including executive sessions that exclude management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consulting with the Compensation Committee Chair and being available to consult with other Committee members between committee meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: providing competitive peer group compensation data for executive positions and evaluating how the compensation we pay the NEOs (as described under Compensation Discussion and Analysis) relates both to the Companys performance and to how the peers compensate their executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: analyzing best practices and providing advice about design of the annual and long-term incentive plans, including selecting performance metrics;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: advising on the composition of the Compensation Survey Group and the Performance Peer Group (as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis) that we use for benchmarking pay and performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: updating the Compensation Committee on executive compensation trends, issues and regulatory developments; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assessing and recommending non-employee director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the year ended December 31, 2016, CAP provided no services to Mondelz International other than consulting services to the Compensation Committee regarding executive and non-employee director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At least annually, the Compensation Committee reviews the current engagements and the objectivity and independence o the advice that CAP provides to it on executive and non-employee director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered the six specific independence factors adopted by the SEC and NASDAQ and determined that CAP is independent and CAPs work did not raise any conflicts of interest.

sentences.text: Executive Officers Have a Limited Role in the Compensation Committees Determination of Executive Compensation and Recommendations to the Board Regarding Non-Employee Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO does not make recommendations or participate in deliberations regarding her own compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers do not play a role in determining or recommending the amount or form of non-employee director compensation.

sentences.text: How the Compensation Committee Manages Compensation-Related Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As it does each year, in 2016, the Compensation Committee evaluated whether our compensation designs, policies and practices operate to discourage our executive officers and other employees from taking unnecessary or excessive risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, we design our compensation to incentivize executives and other employees to achieve the Companys financial and strategic goals as well as individual performance goals that promote long-term shareholder returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation design discourages our executives and other employees from taking excessive risks for short-term benefits that may harm the Company and our shareholders in the long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses various strategies to mitigate risk, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: using both short-term and long-term performance-based compensation so that executives do not focus solely on short-term performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: weighting executive compensation heavily toward long-term incentives to encourage sustainable shareholder value and accountability for long-term results;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: using multiple relevant performance measures in our incentive plan designs, so that executives do not place undue importance on one measure which could distort the results that we want to incent;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: weighting business and individual performance in our annual cash incentive program so that executives and employees do not have too narrow a focus;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: capping the amount of incentives that may be awarded or granted;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: retaining discretion to reduce incentive awards based on unforeseen or unintended consequences and clawback compensation in specified circumstances;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: requiring our top executives to hold a significant amount of their compensation in Common Stock and prohibit them from hedging, pledging or engaging in short sales of their Common Stock;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: not using employment contracts;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: not backdating or re-pricing option grants; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: not paying severance benefits on change in control events unless the affected executive is first involuntarily
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: terminated without cause or terminates due to good reason
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee oversees our ethics and compliance programs that educate executives and other employees on appropriate behavior and the consequences of inappropriate actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs not only drive compliance and integrity but also encourage employees with knowledge of bad behavior to report concerns by providing multiple reporting avenues while protecting reporting employees against retaliation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CAP also reviewed the Compensation Committees risk analysis, including the underlying procedures, and confirmed the Compensation Committees conclusion below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of these analyses, the Compensation Committee believes that our compensation programs do not create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.

sentences.text: Compensation of Non-Employee Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strive to recruit and retain highly qualified non-employee directors who will best represent our shareholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year our Compensation Committee reviews non-employee director compensation to ensure that the compensation we offer supports our objective without being excessive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More specifically, CAP annually benchmarks our non-employee director compensation against our Compensation Survey Group and other Fortune 100 companies and assesses the appropriateness of the form and amount of our non-employee director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CAP provides the Compensation Committee with this data and its independent assessment of the competitiveness of our non-employee directors compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determines whether to recommend any changes to the compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon CAPs 2016 review and recommendation, the Compensation Committee recommended to the Board and the Board determined that no changes would be made to non-employee compensation in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, our shareholder-approved Amended and Restated 2005 Performance Incentive Plan caps at $500,000 the maximum fair market value of Common Stock grants made to any non-employee director in any calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stock grants made in 2016 to non-employee directors were significantly below this amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the 2016 Non-Employee Director Compensation and  Non-Employee Director Equity Awards tables below for specific values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not pay a Company employee who also serves as a director any additional compensation for serving as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, Irene B. Rosenfeld is the only director who is a Company employee.

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Design Principles and Governance Practices Reflect Best Practices to Protect and Promote our Shareholders Interests
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Design Principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What we do:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What we dont do:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Link pay to performance and put pay at risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reward our NEOs based upon the value they add.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 90% of our CEOs compensation and 80% of our other NEOs compensation is at-risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incent short-term results to the detriment of long-term goals and results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incent excessively risky business strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward long-term sustainable performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 75% of our CEOs compensation and 63% of our other NEOs compensation is based on long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target compensation at or near the median of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We compensate fairly and competitively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set substantive performance goals at the beginning of performance cycles and hold executives accountable for delivering on those targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Intend that most performance-based compensation be tax deductible under Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What we dont do:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What we do:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require significant stock ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock ownership requirements are comparable to, or stricter than, our Compensation Survey Group companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide NEOs with tax gross-ups for perquisites or in the event of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taxes are our NEOs responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Require executives to retain equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs must hold net shares upon vesting and net shares acquired upon exercising stock options for at least one year regardless of their ownership level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Re-price underwater stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not re-price outstanding stock options, whether vested or unvested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay dividends on unvested performance share units unless and until shares are earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not pay accrued dividend equivalents unless and until the applicable performance targets are met and we award shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide for clawbacks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We can recoup incentive compensation upon certain financial restatements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibit hedging, pledging and short sales of Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enter into employment agreements with our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We neither enter into employment agreements with our NEOs, nor guarantee salary increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee retains an independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consultant does not provide services to the Company other than advising the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conduct an annual compensation risk assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide separate, enhanced benefit plans for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs generally participate in the same retirement, health and welfare plans broadly available to all U.S. salaried employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Engage with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We regularly engage shareholders through individual and small-group meetings and major investor conferences.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We take input from shareholders into account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Offer limited number of perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer a limited number of perquisites comparable to our Compensation Survey Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay severance and vest equity only upon a double trigger in the event of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our double trigger requires both a change in control and termination of the executives employment either without cause or for good reason.

sentences.text: How We Design Our Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee oversees our executive compensation program focusing on the programs primary goals: 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract, retain and motivate talented executives and develop world-class business leaders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Support business strategies that promote superior long-term shareholder returns;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Align pay and performance by making a significant portion of our executives compensation dependent on achieving financial and other critical strategic and individual goals; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Align our executives and shareholders interests through equity-based incentive grants that link executive compensation to sustained and superior TSR and stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program design supports these goals by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using a Mix of Fixed and Variable Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We heavily weight the mix toward variable compensation to attract, retain and motivate top-performing executives, as well as to appropriately align compensation levels with achieving relevant financial and strategic goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using a Mix of Equity and Cash Incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We heavily weight the mix toward equity that vests over multiple years to focus executives on achieving long-term TSR that exceeds our peers median and to align the mix with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensating Based on Individual Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider an executives individual performance in making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requiring Our Executives to be Significant Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We require our executives to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Own specified levels of Common Stock to align their interests with those of our shareholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hold for one year net shares (shares remaining after the payment of taxes and any exercise price) received upon the exercise of stock options, the vesting of restricted stock and deferred stock units and the award of shares related to performance share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmarking our Compensation and Performance Against Relevant Comparators.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use two grou companies to benchmark our executives compensation and assess our relative performance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: companies to benchmark our executives compensation and assess our relative performance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Survey Group for compensation benchmarking (global peers of similar size who are primarily consumer-facing), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Performance Peer Group to assess relative performance (industry peers).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With CAPs input, the Compensation Committee reviews the composition of these comparator groups to ensure the composition of each remains appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See  Composition and Purpose of our Compensation Survey Group and  Composition and Purpose of our Performance Peer Group below for additional information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paying Competitively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, we compare our compensation programs with those of our Compensation Survey Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We assess whether our executive compensation and target compensation levels are consistent with market practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we compare our financial and TSR performance against our Performance Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Performance Peer Group comparison allows us to link long-term incentive compensation to the delivery of superior financial results relative to industry peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Composition and Purpose of our Compensation Survey Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In constructing our Compensation Survey Group, the Compensation Committee considers global companies with the following attributes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar revenue size;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar market capitalization;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MONDELZ INTERNATIONAL    40
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Primarily focused on food/beverage or consumer/household products or are consumer-facing companies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recognized for their industry leadership and brand recognition;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive positions similar in breadth, complexity and/or scope of responsibility; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitors for executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also considers companies outside the consumer products industry based on the following criteria:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar or higher revenue size
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong global presence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: World-class marketing capabilities specifically focused on the consumer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Manufacturing companies; and

sentences.text: To address unforeseen or unintended consequences, the Compensation Committee retains discretion to adjust the final business performance rating for a performance cycle (up or down) by as much as 25 pp, allowing it to factor in a subjective review of quality of financial results, portfolio management, innovation and talent development.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not consider an NEOs individual contributions as the basis for an award; awards related to performance share units are based solely on how the Company performed against performance targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents accrue during the performance period and are paid out in cash in the first quarter following the award payout date based on the actual share award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses the following formula to determine actual awards for participants, including our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each element of this formula is discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Participants receive dividend equivalents at the end of the performance cycle based on the actual number of shares awarded.

sentences.text: Award Formula Element   Explanation of Key Provisions Target Incentive Opportunity   Each NEOs target number of performance share units is based on 75% of the total annual equity grant value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the end of the performance cycle, the number of shares actually awarded may range from 0% to 200% of the target number of performance share units granted based on the final business performance rating for the performance cycle.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance measures are:           Measures  Weighting       Organic Net Revenue Growth   25%       Adjusted ROIC Increase   25%       Annualized Relative TSR   50%          See  Financial Measure Definitions below for definitions of the above measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For performance share units with a 2016-2018 performance cycle, the target objective set for Annualized Relative TSR is he median of the Performance Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets our financial performance targets for Organic Net Revenue Growth and Adjusted ROIC Increase taking into consideration our long-term strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not publicly disclose specific financial performance targets on a prospective basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revealing these specific targets prospectively would provide competitors and other third parties with insights into our confidential planning process and strategies and potentially harm us competitively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our financial performance targets to be challenging, and there s a plausible risk that no awards will be made or awards will be below target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We base cash awards under our Annual Cash Incentive Program and share awards for our performance share units in part on our Organic Net Revenue Growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee uses a different benchmark to measure performance for each.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requiring Stock Ownership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To further align our NEOs and our shareholders interests, and to incent our NEOs to focus on shareholders interests, the Compensation Committee requires all executives to hold a significant amount of Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following chart summarizes our requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Provisions   Explanation of Key Provisions Ownership Requirement          CEO: Eight times salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other NEOs: Four times salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time to Meet Requirements          Five years from employment date or three years following a promotion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares Counted Toward Ownership          Common Stock, including sole ownership, direct purchase plan shares, qualified savings plans, unvested restricted stock, unvested deferred stock units and accounts over which the executive has direct or indirect ownership or control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2016, we granted restricted stock to employees in some circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excludes unexercised Mondelz International stock options and unvested performance share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holding Requirements          Until they meet their stock ownership requirement, our NEOs must hold 100% of all shares acquired under our equity program (including stock after the restrictions have lapsed, shares awarded for our vested deferred stock units, shares acquired upon exercise of a NQSO and shares awarded for our performance share units), net of shares withheld for taxes or payment of exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once an NEO meets the stock ownership requirements, he or she must hold 100% of the shares, net of shares withheld for taxes or payment of exercise price, for at least one year after the stock option exercise or receipt of shares awarded under our equity program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our stock ownership requirements are comparable to or more stringent than such requirements at the majority of the companies in our Compensation Survey Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We monitor our executives compliance with these requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of March 1, 2017, all of our required NEOs satisfied or exceeded these requirements and adhered to the holding requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other 2016 Compensation Elements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following compensation elements occurred for specific reasons described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They are not part of our recurring compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Retention Equity Grant for Mr. Abelenda
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 4, 2016, the Compensation Committee made a retention-based equity grant to Mr. Abelenda.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This grant consisted of 57,100 stock options that fully vest on the third anniversary of the grant date with the same terms and conditions as the 2015 annual equity grants made to eligible employees generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee made this grant to Mr. Abelenda as an incentive to defer his retirement until the end of 2016 to ensure leadership continuity at an important time in the Latin America region and to provide a smooth transition to his successor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined this amount based on a review of Mr. Abelendas compensation and the value of outstanding equity grants for comparable positions at peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This one-time grant did not affect any of Mr. Abelendas regular compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: International Assignment Payments for Mr. Cofer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to his current role, Mr. Cofer was based in Singapore and served as Executive Vice President and President, Asia Pacific and Eastern Europe, Middle East and Africa until December 31, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a former U.S. expatriate, Mr. Cofer received payments in 2016 related to his repatriation from Singapore to the U.S. These payments to Mr. Cofer were similar to the amounts and types of payments generally made to other employees who repatriate from an international assignment under our International Assignment Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We designed our International Assignment Policy to facilitate relocation of employees to positions in other countries by covering expenses over and above those that the employees would have incurred had they remained in their home countries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such payments cover housing expenses, a cost of living adjustment, education and some travel expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, our International Assignment Policy pays the additional taxes employees incur due solely to their international assignments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Measure Definitions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We report our financial results in accordance with U.S. GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we use non-GAAP financial measures in making financial, operating and planning decisions and in evaluating our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, we also base financial targets for our Annual Cash Incentive Program and performance share units on non-GAAP and other financial measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below defines each measure and describes the adjustments to the related GAAP measure (if applicable), modifications to our non-GAAP measures for purposes of our compensation targets and our reasons for using these measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (See our 2016 Form 10-K for additional information on our Non-GAAP Financial Measures and definitions of terms used in the Definitions column below.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Measures   Definitions (Including Adjustment to GAAP Measure)   Modifications   Rationale Organic Net Revenue Growth (Annual Cash Incentive Program and Performance Share Units)   Organic Net Revenue is defined as net revenues excluding the impacts of:          acquisitions,          divestitures(1),          the historical global coffee business(2),          the historical Venezuelan operations,          accounting calendar changes, and          currency rate fluctuations (calculated based on prior year rates)(3).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Organic Net Revenue Growth: Actual results calculated based on the definition of Organic Net Revenue Growth used for each year of the three-year performance cycle, except for 2015 results which included the historical coffee business for the first half of the year as we wholly owned and managed the coffee business through July 2, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reflects the growth rates for our base business by eliminating the impact of certain disclosed one- time factors, facilitating comparisons to prior year(s).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Defined EPS (Annual Cash Incentive Program) Adjusted EPS is defined as diluted EPS attributable to Mondelz International from continuing operations excluding the impacts of:          Spin-Off Costs(4);          the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program(5);          the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program(5);          Venezuela remeasurement and deconsolidation losses and historical operating results;          losses on debt extinguishment and related expenses;          gains or losses (including non- cash impairment charges) on goodwill and intangible assets;          divestiture(1) or acquisition gains or losses and related integration and acquisition costs;          the JDE coffee business transactions(2) gain, transaction hedging gains or losses and net incremental costs;          gain on the equity method investment exchange;          net earnings from divestitures(1);          mark-to-market impacts from commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivative contracts(6); Defined EPS: Defined as Adjusted EPS calculated at currency exchange rates utilized in our internal financial planning for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EPS Growth: Actual Adjusted EPS results as calculated based on the definition of Adjusted EPS for each year of the three-year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each years growth is then measured based upon the prior years currency exchange rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indicator of overall business trends and performance, based on what business leaders can control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MONDELZ INTERNATIONAL    54
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Measures   Definitions (Including Adjustment to GAAP Measure)   Modifications   Rationale              gains or losses on interest swaps no longer designated as accounting cash flow hedges due to changed financing and hedging plans;   And within Adjusted EPS:          our equity method investment earnings exclude our proportionate share of our investees unusual or infrequent items(8), such as acquisition and divestiture-related costs and restructuring program costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Measures   Definitions (Including Adjustment to GAAP Measure)   Rationale Defined Free Cash Flow (Annual Cash Incentive Program)   Free Cash Flow (Net Cash Provided By Operating Activities less capital expenditures) excluding:          cash payments made for accrued interest and other related fees associated with the debt tendered in the current year;          cash payments (net of tax benefits) associated with Spin-Off Costs, 2012-2014 Restructuring Program expenditures, 2014-2018 Restructuring Program expenditures and incremental costs associated with the coffee business transactions; and          cash payments (net of tax benefits) made for acquisition related costs including integration costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reflects financial liquidity, working capital efficiency and financial health.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Conversion Cycle (Annual Cash Incentive Program)   The Cash Conversion Cycle (CCC) calculates the working capital utilized by the business in terms of number of days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, CCC takes into account the amount of time needed to sell inventory (Days Inventory On Hand (DIOH)), the amount of time needed to collect receivables (Days Sales Outstanding (DSO)) and the amount of time needed to pay suppliers (Days Payable Outstanding (DPO)).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CCC is calculated as follows:          DSO + DIOH  DPO   Reflects a metric used to measure effectiveness in managing working capital and stresses the importance of continued focus on asset and cash management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted ROIC (Performance Share Units)   Adjusted Net Operating Profit After Taxes (NOPAT) divided by Adjusted Invested Capital, which are defined below   Reflects a metric used to evaluate the performance of capital deployment and stresses the importance of continued focus on asset and cash management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted NOPAT is defined as Operating Income less taxes plus Equity Method Investment Earnings excluding the impacts of:          Spin-Off costs(4);          the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program(5);          the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program(5);          Venezuela remeasurement and deconsolidation losses and historical operating results;          gains or losses (including non- cash impairment charges) on goodwill and intangible assets;          divestiture(1) or acquisition gains or losses and related integration and acquisition costs;          the JDE coffee business transactions(2) gain and net incremental costs;   Adjusted Invested Capital (as of year-end balances) is defined as:          Current assets, excluding cash;          Property, Plant and Equipment, net;          Goodwill;          Intangibles, net; and          Other Assets adjusted for the JDE investment step-up recorded in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Less:          Current liabilities, excluding Debt;          Deferred Taxes;          Accrued Pension and Postretirement;          Other Liabilities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MONDELZ INTERNATIONAL    55
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Measures    Definitions (Including Adjustment to GAAP Measure)   Rationale             the operating results of divestitures(1);          our historical global coffee business operating results(2);          mark-to-market impacts from commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivative contracts(6);          equity method investment earnings historically reported with operating income(7);   And Equity Method Investment Earnings excludes:          our proportionate share of our investees unusual or infrequent items(8), such as acquisition and divestiture- related costs and restructuring program costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Divestitures include completed sales of businesses and the exits of major product lines upon completion of a sale or licensing agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) In connection with the JDE coffee business transactions that closed on July 2, 2015, because we exchanged our coffee interests for similarly-sized coffee interests in Jacobs Douwe Egberts (JDE) at the time of the transaction, we have deconsolidated and not included our historical global coffee business results within divestitures in our non-GAAP financial measures and in the related Managements Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations in our 2016 Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to have an ongoing interest in the coffee business and as such, we include the earnings of JDE, Keurig and our historical coffee business within continuing results of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Adjusted EPS, we included these earnings in equity method investment earnings and deconsolidated our historical coffee business results from Organic Net Revenue and Adjusted Operating Income to facilitate comparisons of past and future coffee operating results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Constant currency operating results are calculated by dividing or multiplying, as appropriate, the current-period local currency operating results by the currency exchange rates used to translate the financial statements in the comparable prior-year period to determine what the current-period U.S. dollar operating results would have been if the currency exchange rate had not changed from the comparable prior-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) Refer to Note 2, Divestitures and Acquisitions  Spin-Off of Kraft Foods Group, to the consolidated financial statements in our 2016 Form 10-K for more information on Spin-Off Costs incurred in connection with the October 1, 2012 spin-off of the Kraft Foods Group grocery business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) Non-GAAP adjustments related to the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program and the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program reflect costs incurred that relate to the objectives of our program to transform our supply chain network and organizational structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Costs that do not meet the program objectives are not reflected in the non-GAAP adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) During the third quarter of 2016, we began to exclude unrealized gains and losses (mark-to-market impacts) from outstanding commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives from our non-GAAP earnings measures until such time that the related exposures impact our operating results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since we purchase commodity and forecasted currency transaction contracts to mitigate price volatility primarily for inventory requirements in future periods, we made this adjustment to remove the volatility of these future inventory purchases on current operating results to facilitate comparisons of our underlying operating performance across periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also discontinued designating commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives for hedge accounting treatment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To facilitate comparisons of our underlying operating results, we have recast all historical non-GAAP earnings measures to exclude the mark-to-market impacts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (7) Historically, we have recorded income from equity method investments within our operating income as these investments operated as extensions of our base business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in the third quarter of 2015, we began to record the earnings from our equity method investments in after-tax equity method investment earnings outside of operating income following the deconsolidation of our coffee business See Note 1, Summary of Significant Accounting Policies  Principles of Consolidation, to the consolidated financial statements in our 2016 Form 10-K for more information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In periods prior to July 2, 2015, we have reclassified the equity method earnings from our Adjusted Operating Income to after-tax equity method investment earnings within Adjusted EPS to be consistent with the deconsolidation of our coffee business results on July 2, 2015 and in order to evaluate our operating results on a consistent basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (8) We have excluded our proportionate share of our equity method investees unusual or infrequent items in order to provide investors with a comparable view of our performance across periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we have shareholder rights and board representation commensurate with our ownership interests in our equity method investees and review the underlying operating results and unusual or infrequent items with them each reporting period, we do not have direct control over their operations or resulting revenue and expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our use of equity method investment net earnings on an adjusted basis is not intended to imply that we have any such control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our GAAP diluted EPS attributable to Mondelz International from continuing operations includes all of the investees unusual and infrequent items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our NEOs were eligible to participate in the Mondelz Global LLC Executive Deferred Compensation Plan (MEDCP), a voluntary non-qualified deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MEDCP allows executives to defer, on a pre-tax basis, up to 50% of their salary and up to 100% of their award under the Annual Cash Incentive Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives may nvest deferred amounts in one or more notional investment options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MEDCP is similar to plans provided to executive officers at many of the companies in our Compensation Survey Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes the MEDCP aids in recruitment and assists executives in managing their future cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer limited perquisites similar to those offered by companies in our Compensation Survey Group and do so at comparable costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes these limited perquisites are important for retention and recruitment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer our NEOs car and financial planning allowances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offered our NEOs executive physicals during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective in early 2017, we no longer offer executive physicals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the findings of an independent, third-party security study, we require Ms. Rosenfeld to use a private (non-commercial) aircraft for both business and personal travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through early May 2016, Ms. Rosenfeld used the Company-owned aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the sale of the Company-owned aircraft, Ms. Rosenfeld used a Company- leased aircraft for business and personal travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of private aircraft allows Ms. Rosenfeld to be more productive and efficient when she travels, particularly since we do business in approximately 165 countries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs are solely responsible for all taxes on all perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide no tax gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The footnotes to the Summary Compensation Table under Executive Compensation Tables list the perquisites we provided to our NEOs during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement and Separation Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Employment Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not enter into employment agreements with any of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs, including Ms. Rosenfeld, are at will employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described below, we offer our NEOs retirement and separation benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, our NEOs are eligible for broad-based U.S. employee benefit plans, including two tax-qualified plans  the Mondelz Global LLC Retirement Plan (Retirement Plan) and the Mondelz Global LLC Thrift Plan (Thrift Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accruals under the Retirement Plan and the defined benefit portion of the Supplemental Plan (as defined below) will ceas after 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide an unfunded non-qualified plan, the Mondelz Global LLC Supplemental Benefits Plan (Supplemental Plan), for eligible U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Supplemental Plan provides benefits that are not provided under the Retirement Plan or Thrift Plan due to an employees compensation exceeding the tax-qualified plan compensation limit under Code Section 401(a)(17), an employees election to defer compensation under either the MEDCP or the Supplemental Plan, or a Retirement Plan participants benefit exceeding the limits under Section 415 of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. employees hired after 2008 are not eligible to participate in the Retirement Plan or the defined benefit portion of the Supplemental Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They are eligible to receive an enhanced employer contribution under the Thrift Plan and the defined contribution portion of the Supplemental Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MONDELZ INTERNATIONAL    57
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes the Retirement Plan, Thrift Plan and non-qualified Supplemental Plan are integral parts of our overall executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes our NEOs should receive the same defined benefit accruals, be able to defer the same percentage of their compensation and receive the same corresponding notional employer contributions as all other employees, without regard to the Codes compensation limit applicable to tax-qualified plans or whether the NEO has elected to defer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As disclosed in the 2016 Summary Compensation Table under Executive Compensation Tables, the present value of Ms. Rosenfelds defined benefit pension increased $901,750 from the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary drivers of the present value ncrease are the decrease in the applicable discount rate and an increase in benefit service, which resulted in a present value increase of approximately $1.2 million and $0.6 million, respectively, offset by a change in age, which resulted in a present value decrease of approximately $0.9 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide Ms. Rosenfeld with a non-qualified, enhanced pension benefit that credits her pension service for the period of time (2004-2006) that she was employed by another company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide this enhanced pension benefit to Ms. Rosenfeld because, when she rejoined the Company, she forfeited her right to a pension benefit at her previous employer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This benefit was part of a broader incentive program we offered to encourage her to return to the Company and become our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Pension Benefits table and the accompanying narrative to the table under Executive Compensation Tables provide additional details about this benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, we announced Mr. Abelenda would retire from the Company effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Abelendas retirement details are described under Executive Compensation Tables  Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Severance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a Change in Control Severance Plan (the CIC Plan) for key senior executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CIC Plan is consistent with similar plans maintained by companies in our Compensation Survey Group, including eligibility and severance benefit levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We structure separation payments to help assure that key executives, including our NEOs, would be available to facilitate a successful transition following a change in control and provide a competitive level of severance protection if the executive is involuntarily terminated without cause or resigns for good reason within two years following a change in control (double trigger).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that a payment under the CIC Plan or otherwise triggers an excise tax under Code Section 4999, the payment will be the greater of the full benefit or a reduced benefit that does not trigger the excise tax as determined on an after-tax basis for each.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide any tax gross-ups for taxes payable on change in control benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We further describe the severance arrangements and other benefits provided under the CIC Plan (as well as the equity treatment upon certain separations in the event of a change in control) under Executive Compensation Tables  Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Change in Control Severance Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we generally do not have individual severance or employment agreements with any of our NEOs, we would typically provide separation benefits as consideration for the NEO entering into an agreement protecting our interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance payments and other benefits provided to a typical NEO are described under Executive Compensation Tables  Potential Payments upon Termination or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Policy Authorizing Recoupment of Executive Incentive Compensation in the Event of Certain Restatements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board or an appropriate committee of the Board may determine that, as a result of a restatement of our financial statements, an executive officer received more compensation than the executive officer would have received absent the incorrect financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board or committee, in its discretion, may then take the actions it deems necessary or appropriate to address the events that gave rise to the restatement and to prevent its recurrence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those actions may include, to the extent permitted by applicable law:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: requiring the executive officer to repay some or all of any annual or other incentive compensation paid;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MONDELZ INTERNATIONAL    58
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: requiring the executive officer to repay any gains realized on the exercise of stock options or on the open- market sale of vested shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: canceling some or all of the executive officers restricted stock or deferred stock unit grants, performance share units and outstanding stock options;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: adjusting the executive officers future compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: terminating the executive officer; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: initiating legal action against the executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Trading Restrictions, Anti-Hedging Policy and Anti-Pledging Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our insider trading policy limits the timing and types of transactions in Mondelz International securities by Section 16 officers, including our NEOs (and any member of the Section 16 officers family sharing the same household, any corporations or other business entities they control or manage and any trusts of which they are the trustee or otherwise have investment control over).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other restrictions, the policy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: allows Section 16 officers to trade company securities only during open window periods and only after they have pre-cleared transactions with the Corporate Secretary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: prohibits Section 16 officers from short-selling company securities or selling against the box (failing to delive sold securities); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: prohibits Section 16 officers from entering into transactions in puts, calls or other derivatives on Mondelz International securities on an exchange or in any other organized market, as well as any other derivative or hedging transactions on Mondelz International securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our insider trading policy also prohibits our directors, executive officers and certain additional executives from holding Mondelz International securities in a margin account or pledging Mondelz International securities as collateral for a loan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Policy on Qualifying Compensation for Tax Deductibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code Section 162(m) limits to $1.0 million annually our ability to deduct compensation paid to certain NEOs (the covered employees).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Covered employees under Code Section 162(m) include our principal executive officer and our next three highest paid executive officers, other than our principal financial officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This limit does not apply to performance-based compensation, provided certain conditions are satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company generally intends that the Annual Cash Incentive Program awards and awards under our equity program qualify as performance-based compensation and are thus tax- deductible under Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the application of Section 162(m) is complex and may change with time (with a potentially retroactive effect).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, not all of these awards may actually qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Compensation Committee retains the discretion to authorize payments that may not be tax-deductible if it believes such payments are in the shareholders best interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the Compensation Committee decided, based on benchmarking salaries of other chief executive officers in the Compensation Survey Group and CAPs advice, to pay Ms. Rosenfeld an annual base salary in excess of $1.0 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, a portion of her 2016 salary was not tax- deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) Consistent with the findings of an independent, third-party security study, for security and personal safety, we require Ms. Rosenfeld to use a private (non-commercial) aircraft for all travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through early May 2016, Ms. Rosenfeld used the Company-owned aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the sale of the Company-owned aircraft, Ms. Rosenfeld used a Company-leased aircraft for all travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incremental cost of personal use of the Company-owned aircraft, as reflected in the table, includes the cost of trip-related crew hotels and meals, in-flight food and beverages, landing and ground handling fees, hourly maintenance contract costs, hangar or aircraft parking costs, fuel costs based on the average annual cost of fuel per hour flown, and other smaller variable costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed costs that would be incurred in any event to operate the Company-owned aircraft (for example, aircraft purchase costs, maintenance not related to personal trips and flight crew salaries) are not included in the incremental cost of Ms. Rosenfelds use of the Company-owned aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The incremental cost of personal use of the Company-leased aircraft, as reflected in the table, is the actual invoice to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Rosenfeld is responsible for taxes in connection with her personal aircraft use and we do not reimburse her for those taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) All executive officers are eligible for an annual financial counseling allowance up to $7,500 and, in the case of Ms. Rosenfeld, up to $10,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) All eligible U.S. employees, including our NEOs, receive matching Company contributions for contributions made to the Mondelz Global LLC Thrift Plan and Mondelz Global LLC Supplemental Benefits Plan I, if applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, all eligible U.S. employees hired after 2008, who are not otherwise eligible to participate in the Mondelz Global LLC Retirement Plan, including Mr. Gladden and Mr. Marques, receive an additional non-elective Company contribution to the Mondelz Global LLC Thrift Plan and Mondelz Global LLC Supplemental Benefits Plan I, if applicable, equal to 4.5% of eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) Mr. Cofer, a former U.S. expatriate, who repatriated back to the U.S. in 2016, received payments in conjunction with his international assignment based in Singapore.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These payments were similar to the types of payments generally made to other employees who accept an international assignment with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payments are designed to facilitate the relocation of employees to positions in other countries by covering expenses over and above those that employees accepting assignments would have incurred had they remained in their home countries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These payments include housing expenses, cost of living adjustment, schooling, travel expenses and other repatriation related expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expenses incurred in Singapore are converted to U.S. dollars using the exchange rate on the first of the month in which the expense was paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tax payments are made pursuant to our International Assignment Policy, which is designed to cover the additional taxes that an employee incurs due solely to the international assignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (e) Generally, all salaried employees in the United States are eligible for a computer allowance up to $1,500 under our Bring Your Own Computer Program, which allows eligible employees to purchase a computer of choice for work purposes.

sentences.text: In accordance with the program, Mr. Abelenda received a $1,500 computer allowance and corresponding payment of $1,084 to cover the taxes.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mondelz Global LLC Supplemental Benefits Plan I
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the Code limits the amount that may be contributed to our U.S. tax-qualified defined contribution plan on behalf of an employee, we offer a supplemental defined contribution program under the Mondelz Global LLC Supplemental Benefits Plan I. This is an unfunded non-qualified plan that allows eligible employees to defer a portion of their annual compensation (base salary and AIP awards) and receive corresponding matching amounts to the extent that their contributions to the tax-qualified defined contribution plan (and the corresponding matching contributions) are limited by Code Sections 401(a)(17) or 415.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The timing of distributions depends on whether the amount distributed is subject to Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For distributions not subject to Code Section 409A, the distribution will be made in accordance with the employees distribution election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For distributions subject to Code Section 409A, employees will receive their account balances in a lump sum soon after separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (An employee who is a specified employee for purposes of Code Section 409A will have the lump sum delayed for six months.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred and notional employer matching contributions earn the same notional rate of return as the Income Fund, which is a market rate investment option available to participants in the U.S. tax-qualified defined contribution plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rate of return under this investment option in 2016 was 2.04%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mondelz Global LLC Executive Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MEDCP is a non-qualified plan that allows our NEOs to defer, on a pre-tax basis, up to 50% of salary and up to 100% of their AIP award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notional investment options are similar to those offered to participants in our U.S. tax-qualified defined contribution plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive who elects to defer compensation must decide whether to defer receipt of the compensation until the executives separation from service, as determined under Code Section 409A, or to receive a distribution while still employed with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distributions may be made in a lump sum or annual installments of between two and ten years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (An executive who is a specified employee for purposes of Code Section 409A will have the distribution delayed for six months following a separation from service.)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notional investment options available to the executives under the MEDCP are selected by the Company and may be changed from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
